task.summary: Default task
Added a column in the output file for the initial value of the rng seed

Made methods const where applicable
Most methods in MonteCarlo, Geometric, Reconstructor, and Simulator should have been const. In order for Simulator.NumberCherenkovPhotons to be const, the integrate needed to be copied and passed to the method. The TF1.SetParameter method call technically modifies the TF1 object.
Optimization in PhotonCount constructor
Constant time SumBins method
Changed thinning rates to integers
Schmidt corrector tweak
Tweaks to thinning
Adding 3000 simulated showers to GitHub
Adding data files to repo
Adding combined data file to repo
Changing AddSubtractNoise test to TypicalShowerEntire and modifying
Added ROOT macro for plotting CSV files
Fixed compiler flags
Updated ReadMe file
Tweaking build settings and output analysis
Updated documentation
Switched queue for list and size_t (unsigned int) for unsigned short, optimization of GetTriggeringState
Fixed some warnings, switched back to using size_t in traversal algorithms
Fixed minor problem introduced in previous commit
Adding CLion settings and switching release/debug decision to CLion build configurations
Preventing out of memory crashes

Started work on unit test suite
Wrote or outlined a number of tests for the PhotonCount class. As part of this process, some method specifications were pinned down more specifically in their comments.
More work on unit tests, still not finished
More unit test definitions
More unit tests, bleh
Small unit test changes

IMPORTANT: Correction to math
Found an issue with math when calculating the number of Cherenkov photons reflected. Changed a factor of 4 to a factor of 2, which will alter the output of future simulations.
JK on that last one

Completed DataStructures unit tests
Added some additional error checking. Also discovered a few issues. The FindThreshold metohd returned slightly wrong values, due to an incorrect use of erfc and an off by one error. The Subtract method wasn't subtracting - it was actually adding (didn't notice this sooner because noise levels are so low).

Updated documentation of DataStructures
Also made some minor style changes, but logic should not be impacted.

Preparing for data collection
Tweaked a couple of XML settings in preparation for large overnight data collection.
Reverting optimization that could result in an empty fitting dataset

Finished unit testing on Geometric
Found a few issues: - Plane normal vector wasn't being made unit (this is just a specification thing and probably wasn't causing problems) - PropagateToPlane was reversing the direction if the plane was behind the ray (it should add a negative time and keep direction the same) - Checking for total internal reflection in the Refract method - Fixed the ImpactAngle method (THIS ONE IS IMPORTANT!!!)
Updated documentation and style of Geometric files

Performed some data analysis on initial run
Plots are included. Upcoming experiments: - Vary the height of the detector and see how this impacts the trend against distance - Vary the pixel size (make twice as small) - Improve the ground impact algorithm by averaging the eight adjacent pixels
Other TODOs: - Make vertical graph scales the same - Do some investigation into why the Cherenkov algorithm does so poorly in some cases (make sure the ground impact is correct) - Try filtering data based on the trends seen in profiles

Moved all hard-coded parameters to Utility
Also decided not to change the ground point finding algorithm - just to vary detector height and resolution.
Refactoring Shower class after moving hard-coded parameters to Utility
Cleanup of MonteCarlo and general refactoring
Moving things around to prepare for more data generation

Cleaned up unit testing and improved parameter documentation
Major changes: - Defined the new MonteCarlo::RunSingleShower method to help clean up testing framework - The PerformMonteCarlo method will not increment its counter unless the detector is triggered. Previously, the counter was incremented whenever a shower passed through the field of view.
Adding results from increased resolution run to repository
Adding results from increased height run to repository
Re-adding double resolution run data

Changes to improve simulation output
Changes: - Fixed a problem where multiple ROOT objects with the same name were being written - Angles are converted to degrees before being written to CSV file - Shower ground impact distances are written to CSV file
Fixed cherenkov_test compiler errors
Trying to isolate a weird Cherenkov reconstruction bug

Discovered indexing error in PerformMonteCarlo
Also noticed that some showers have their Cherenkov peaks removed by noise filtration, but the fluorescence track still crosses the horizon. Cherenkov reconstruction does very poorly on these. Will note this in write-up and perform some kind of data trimming to keep histograms from being skewed.
Spaces are bad, mkay?
Adding final data to repository

MESSAGE.value: More unit tests, bleh
Small unit test changes

IMPORTANT: Correction to math
Found an issue with math when calculating the number of Cherenkov photons reflected. Changed a factor of 4 to a factor of 2, which will alter the output of future simulations.
JK on that last one

Completed DataStructures unit tests
Added some additional error checking. Also discovered a few issues. The FindThreshold metohd returned slightly wrong values, due to an incorrect use of erfc and an off by one error. The Subtract method wasn't subtracting - it was actually adding (didn't notice this sooner because noise levels are so low).

Updated documentation of DataStructures
Also made some minor style changes, but logic should not be impacted.

Preparing for data collection
Tweaked a couple of XML settings in preparation for large overnight data collection.
Reverting optimization that could result in an empty fitting dataset

Finished unit testing on Geometric
Found a few issues: - Plane normal vector wasn't being made unit (this is just a specification thing and probably wasn't causing problems) - PropagateToPlane was reversing the direction if the plane was behind the ray (it should add a negative time and keep direction the same) - Checking for total internal reflection in the Refract method - Fixed the ImpactAngle method (THIS ONE IS IMPORTANT!!!)
Updated documentation and style of Geometric files

Performed some data analysis on initial run
Plots are included. Upcoming experiments: - Vary the height of the detector and see how this impacts the trend against distance - Vary the pixel size (make twice as small) - Improve the ground impact algorithm by averaging the eight adjacent pixels
Other TODOs: - Make vertical graph scales the same - Do some investigation into why the Cherenkov algorithm does so poorly in some cases (make sure the ground impact is correct) - Try filtering data based on the trends seen in profiles

Moved all hard-coded parameters to Utility
Also decided not to change the ground point finding algorithm - just to vary detector height and resolution.
Refactoring Shower class after moving hard-coded parameters to Utility
Cleanup of MonteCarlo and general refactoring
Moving things around to prepare for more data generation

Cleaned up unit testing and improved parameter documentation
Major changes: - Defined the new MonteCarlo::RunSingleShower method to help clean up testing framework - The PerformMonteCarlo method will not increment its counter unless the detector is triggered. Previously, the counter was incremented whenever a shower passed through the field of view.
Adding results from increased resolution run to repository

Re-adding double resolution run data

Changes to improve simulation output
Changes: - Fixed a problem where multiple ROOT objects with the same name were being written - Angles are converted to degrees before being written to CSV file - Shower ground impact distances are written to CSV file
Fixed cherenkov_test compiler errors
Trying to isolate a weird Cherenkov reconstruction bug

Discovered indexing error in PerformMonteCarlo
Also noticed that some showers have their Cherenkov peaks removed by noise filtration, but the fluorescence track still crosses the horizon. Cherenkov reconstruction does very poorly on these. Will note this in write-up and perform some kind of data trimming to keep histograms from being skewed.
Spaces are bad, mkay?
Adding final data to repository
